name: FiltererModulus
description: The `FiltererModulus` class is an event filterer that allows only every nth event to pass through, where n is the specified quotient. This is useful for reducing event frequency or sampling events at regular intervals. Instances are typically created through `JsMacros.createModulusEventFilterer()` or by using the constructor directly.

constructors.description: Creates a new FiltererModulus instance that allows every nth event to pass through.

parameters.name: quotient
parameters.description: The modulus value - allows every nth event. The quotient is automatically converted to its absolute value, so negative values are treated as positive.

methods.name: test
methods.description: Checks if the event should pass through the filter based on the current modulus. Returns true if the event passes, false otherwise. The internal counter resets to 0 each time an event passes through.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event to be checked against the filter.

methods.name: setQuotient
methods.description: Adjusts the modulus value (quotient) of the filter dynamically, controlling how often events pass through.

parameters.name: quotient
parameters.description: The new modulus value. Negative values are automatically converted to positive.
